alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 12:51AM PDT until March 17 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 430 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over the past 24 hours. - Rainfall is expected to continue overnight tapering off later this morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rainfall rates of 0.20 to 0.30 inches per hour, locally up to 0.50 inches per hour expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, southern Corona, Costa Mesa, Mission Viejo, Tustin, San Clemente, Laguna Beach and Dana Point. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
